meanings.sent1: She tried to befool him with a fake treasure map.
meanings.sent2: The magician used sleight of hand to befool the audience.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to befool the dog by hiding its toy.
meanings.sent4: The con artist's smooth talk was meant to befool the unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent5: The clever disguise was used to befool the guards and gain entry.

meanings.definition: To make someone appear foolish or stupid
meanings.sent1: His friends played a prank to befool him on April Fools' Day.
meanings.sent2: The bully's actions were meant to befool the new student in front of everyone.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes were so silly that they managed to befool the entire audience.
meanings.sent4: The fake news story was designed to befool the public and create confusion.
meanings.sent5: The misleading advertisement aimed to befool customers into buying unnecessary products.
